alert.note: Alert for Coastal Duval; Coastal Nassau; Coastal St. Johns; Inland St. Johns (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 5:32AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Waterspouts possible over the waters this morning... At 529 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms, capable of producing waterspouts. These thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Fernandina Beach to 44 nm east of Guana River State Park. Movement was north at 5 mph. HAZARD...Waterspouts possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Locations impacted include... St. Marys, Brunswick, Saint Augustine, St. Simons Island, Fernandina Beach, Unf, Kings Bay Base, Ponte Vedra Beach, Yulee and Neptune Beach. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Waterspouts are possible with this activity. If a waterspout occurs, move your boat away from it. Waterspouts can develop rapidly and produce winds and seas that are dangerous for vessels and everyone onboard.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Duval; Coastal Nassau; Coastal St. Johns; Inland St. Johns
